title: [Feng5 rom review]nexus experience 10.4 for mot0 x 2014 review

threads.text:
2. Special function
This ROM support ambient display and live display. You can change the RGB in color calibration to fix the yellow screen problem .
It also support moto gesture, like twist for quick capture and chop twice for flashlight.
You can change which app can start when the phone boot up in memory menu.
Theme engine is support cm theme pack,. It also can customize.
There is the one-click-clear  button in recent app list.
You also can back to previous app by holding recent button and lock screen by double tapping navigation bar.

3. Performance 
I think this ROM is smooth in mostly time. In balance mode(this ROM have three battery mode: performance, balance ,power save). The geekbench4 result is about 1000(single-core) and 2500(multi-core). Let's see some screenshots(based on balance mode):
Setting slides smoothly.
Google now slides a little bit laggy.
Play store doesn't slide smoothly. 
Screenshots(based on performance mode):
Everything is more smoothly.

4. Battery life
Battery data log:
9/13
0:07(100%)-21:45(29%)
SOT(screen on time)   2h58m56s 556mah
Cell standby(LTE)   189mah

9/14
23:26(100%)-21:30(11%)
SOT   4:57:30  907mah
Cell standby  366mah

9/15 
0:00(100%)-17:27(15%)
SOT   4:10:01  802mah
Cell standby    247mah

9/17
0:00(100%)-22:27(31%)
SOT     3:49:23   785mah
Cell standby  295mah

9/18
0:00(100%)-21:28(5%)
SOT  5:8:55 1090mah 
Cell standby 303mah

I think battery life is much better than Miro's stock ROM. I just used ice box to freeze some apps that I seldom use. I don't use any battery save apps like greenify or prevent running.

5.Summary 
I think this ROM is great. Battery life is great. The system is smoothly in most time. Many special functions are useful. But sometimes when you swipe to unlock your phone , you can feel laggy.
Maybe this is a little bug and it doesn't  matter. 
So, finally ,I think this ROM can be a daily driver.
It is stable now and without huge bug.
Sorry for my poor English .
are u really sure Nexus based cm?I remembered it was based aosp not cm

replies.text: Oh,nexus experience is based on aosp. I already corrected in this article. I forgot this important thing

threads.text: Or you can download Emoji switcher on Play Store ! Easy and more choice

title: [REQ] Android M Preview 3 boot animation for Moto X 2014

threads.text: http://forum.xda-developers.com/nexu...2#post62381522

replies.text:
Thanks for the link! I replaced the existing boot animations in the following locations:

\DATA\Local\MOODLE  <---New Moto 'thread and needle' animation
and
\SYSTEM\MEDIA\    <---Old Moto 'global' animation

Both of those animations contain mp4 animations. I replaced with the one you linked and rebooted...unfortunately only the tail end of the animation cycles. I may look into converting this animation into a MP4 in case that will help.

Correction to my post - I was able to get the boot animation working fine. I did all the steps quoted above, in addition to changing the permissions on the bootanimation.zip file to RW+R+R. The animation plays properly and looks great too.

threads.text:
I flashed it number of times.. still stuck with Moto default boot. 
i have bootanimation-encrypted.zip file.. Should i remove it den flash?
Plz suggest.

replies.text: It's not a flashable zip. It needs to be manually copy/pasted to /system/media on the root partition of your device.  You also need to set the correct permissions to  rw-r--r--.

title: [REVIEW] i-Blason Prime Series Dual Layer Holster Case

threads.text: I think they market the identical case under the Fossman name too.  I have one for my Moto G and also only use it when active/traveling.

replies.text:
Me too. Yesterday a tried to use the holster for a complete day and I couldn't.

It's still a hassle to take the phone out with one hand 
and the volume buttons get pressed every time you put it in. 







You're right after days of use it is less prone to attract stuff to it. 

Also noticed that the silicon fit is not as tight as the first days but at least the hard  plastic wrapping it keeps it in place.

threads.text:
I use to run the Trident cases on all my devices..the "SUPER MAGNET" part, will probably go away after a few weeks of use..the silicone trim, when new, attracts ever particle of lint and dust, but I found, after a few weeks of use, the "stickiness" (newness) of the silicone goes away, and attracts alot less particles..

title: Body Glove SATIN case - updated with review

threads.text: I purchased this case from eBAy a couple of months ago. I like it, I switch between this case and the Hula bumper.

Thanks for the pics but you said a few months ago? Lol man I have been checking for new cases a few times since I got the phone and never saw this case. Think the biggest problem is perhaps finding cases due to the official name being the same as last years.

Think motorola needs to make an official name sequence or something like htc did with the HTC one m7 and m8. I think making the model year part of the name would be cool; like cars and most other things with wheels.

replies.text:
Yeah I was searching on eBay for cases and came across the listing. I was nervous that it was going to be for the 2013 model but the description said 2nd generation so I gave it a try. It's really hard to find cases for the phone, one thing I look at in the pics are to see which wallpaper they show in the phone. Sometimes that helps to distinguish the different models. Try searching with 2014 and/or 2nd generation in your searches.  

Motorola definitely should update the naming convention on these phones.

threads.text:
The funny part is that some case makers are too lazy to update their wallpaper image. My tudia case arrived with a cardboard of the gen1 wallpaper and initially thought they sent the wrong one until I opened it. Also body glove on the moto x shows the gen 1 for the moto x but only has a case for the gen2 which is funny and maybe why I didn't notice this one sooner since I literally went on their site a few weeks ago.

Yeah the naming needs to be easier to tell which model year. Oh well. Love the phone lol
It doesn't look too shabby but historically, body glove's cases haven't been the best quality.  Will wait to hear impressions before I decide if I want to order it or not.

Well it came in earlier than expected (woo hoo!) and I updated the OP to include some pics. 

I like the look of the case, it seems to add some bulk compared to the Tudia case I have though. It seems and feels thicker I think due to the flatter lines (back is still curved) but both cases on the table visually cant be more than 0.5mm difference. I have mixed feelings about it, I wish the case was thinner honestly but I do like it. Really need to use it a day or two so I can form an opinion on it. There are "sharp" edges which really help the phone feel secure in the hand. The shock factor would be no greater than any other TPU case. Overall fit of it against the moto x is solid though. The power and volume buttons are I would say for a normal adult moderate/easy to press due to the size of the openings. The Tudia requires extra force to overcome the case materials flex and the body glove one your physically pressing the button but the opening can be a bit of a restriction for some (and I dont have sausage fingers either lol).

I would say the one flaw I saw is the molding is a bit off on one of the mics which is seen in one pic. The hole is technically in the right spot and honestly its probably fine but its like there is some molding that needs to be cut a bit which I will do to my sample.

Overall Im looking forward to using this case for the next few days and see how it goes. Cosmetics wise I think it beats the Tudia hands down, lets see how it goes functionally.

of what material is the honeycomb pattern inside made. I ask because of a picture posted by one Amazon reviewer.



I don't have a leather back, but do you think it would be pressing too hard on a soft touch back. ?

Wow thats bad but with leather I could have seen that coming. Yesterday I saw a honeycomb on my soft touch back but looked like some oils from the case since it wiped off. After a full day today I will update.

Worst case it will give me a good excuse to mod my back. I have been googling carbon fiber material to make my own back but havent had the courage to do it just yet lol

Thanks for the pics but you said a few months ago? Lol man I have been checking for new cases a few times since I got the phone and never saw this case. Think the biggest problem is perhaps finding cases due to the official name being the same as last years.

Think motorola needs to make an official name sequence or something like htc did with the HTC one m7 and m8. I think making the model year part of the name would be cool; like cars and most other things with wheels.

title: [VIDEO REVIEW] Cruzerlite Bugdroid Circuit for Moto X 2014
[VIDEO REVIEW] Poetic Affinity Case for Moto X (2014)
[VIDEO REVIEW] Diztronic TPU for Moto X 2014

threads.text: just got the same case today, and it's definitely a keeper.  I tried the Hyperion and Tudia cases but chose the Diztronic because of fit and finish.  i also have a bodyguardz tempered glass protector and it fits with case, meaning no rubbing on the lip.  with the protector on, the lip is reduced to about 1/4 mm.  i removed the bodyguardz because of poor seal around the edges.

replies.text: I'm waiting for the XtremeGuard Spartan Glass for mine

threads.text: I agree with this review. The feel of the material is excellent. It adds just enough texture to make sure it doesn't slip out of your hand, without being so grippy that it is tough to get in and out of pockets. I also agree with the comments on the buttons. I think they have a very nice tactile feel and responsiveness to them.  I don't use a case often, but when I'm going to be outside on concrete or setting my phone down where it could get knocked over easily, I like to throw a case on it. This one adds very little bulk so I am pretty happy with it. Like the reviewer, I also wish Diztronic had included a cutout for the Motorola "M" dimple, but it is certainly not a deal breaker.

I got the diztronic case but don't like it.  The raised power button keeps on pressing in my pocket and causes the phone to reboot.  I actually got a cruzrlite bugdroid circuit one with cutouts for the buttons.  This one is just as good as the diztronic one.

title: Review: Motorola Moto X for Verizon Wireless

threads.text: It's good that Verizon didn't mess with it too much at least.

The more I read about this phone the more I'm going away from it. Was really exited for this phone but I really can't regress in battery life and lose wireless charging and no SD card is ruining it for me. I keep trying to justify buying it, but don't think I can do it. Im currently on a G2, which from most reviews still rates higher. 

I guess I'll wait and see what this Droid Turbo has to offer. At this point I only think I would need root for a current moto phone.

Just my opinion.

threads.text: Droid life review said the scuffs seem to make it look better as they accumulate. Not sure why he mentions the fact that leather doesn't like water, last I checked smartphones don't like water.

If you own leather things you know it is sensitive to scuff, but it will still last a long time. They let a company that is expert at it provide the material so they would know ahead of time how it'll be.

Overall it's a balanced review, definitely doesn't bash the device,  he have a good command of viewership so it should help introduce the phone to a few more people.

I don't want to accept 12 hrs as a good thing, when I could have 24 for example, plus other makers are doing it, even with smaller form factors (Sony Z3c) so I stand by my opinion that Moto dropped the ball with a small battery, especially as the new display is more battery hungry.

replies.text: I do agree that Moto could have done better with the battery size, but every person is different in what satisfies them in terms of battery. Totally understandable. I just need it to last half a day. I also have an external battery pack, so I am not too worried about not charging

threads.text: With the same usage moto x lasts more then my old s3

Phonearena is a bit over the top with they're assessments.  They always rank phones so much lower than even the average customer.  Just look at the reviews of other moto x and nexus 5 etc customers always rate higher. I'll take the average persons word over these overly analytical reviewers

It's been confirmed that it's single speaker, it even say so on motorola.com. But the speaker is supposed to be plenty loud. Not sure how good the audio quality is yet, but the quality of the previous X was good.

threads.text: Don't know but to me if the G has stereo why wouldn't the X makes nonsense
